solution_line_template: Wilson had ${initial_balance} + ${deposited_last_month}= $<<{initial_balance}+{deposited_last_month}={balance_before_withdrawal}>>{balance_before_withdrawal} two months ago before making a withdrawal.
His money in his account now is ${initial_balance} + ${more_than_two_months_ago} = $<<{initial_balance}+{more_than_two_months_ago}={current_balance}>>{current_balance}.
Since he deposited ${deposited_this_month} this month, this means there was ${current_balance} - ${deposited_this_month} = ${balance_after_withdrawal_last_month} last month after making a withdrawal.
